listitem.para: void HASH_ITConfig ( uint8_t HASH_IT, FunctionalState NewState)
ErrorStatus HASH_SHA1 ( uint8_t * Input, uint32_t Ilen, uint8_t Output)
ErrorStatus HMAC_SHA1 ( uint8_t * Key, uint32_t Keylen, uint8_t * Input, uint32_t Ilen, uint8_t Output)
ErrorStatus HASH_MD5 ( uint8_t * Input, uint32_t Ilen, uint8_t Output)
ErrorStatus HMAC_MD5 ( uint8_t * Key, uint32_t Keylen, uint8_t * Input, uint32_t Ilen, uint8_t Output)

section.title: void HASH_DeInit (void)
section.emphasis: Deinitializes the HASH peripheral registers to their default reset values.

section.title: void HASH_Init (HASH_InitTypeDef *HASH_InitStruct)
section.emphasis: Initializes the HASH peripheral according to the specified parameters in the HASH_InitStruct structure.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: the hash processor is reset when calling this function so that the HASH will be ready to compute the message digest of a new message. There is no need to call HASH_Reset() function.

entry.para: pointer to a HASH_InitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration information for the HASH peripheral.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: The field HASH_HMACKeyType in HASH_InitTypeDef must be filled only if the algorithm mode is HMAC.

section.title: void HASH_StructInit (HASH_InitTypeDef *HASH_InitStruct)
section.emphasis: Fills each HASH_InitStruct member with its default value.

entry.para: : pointer to a HASH_InitTypeDef structure which will be initialized.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: The default values set are : Processor mode is HASH, Algorithm selected is SHA1, Data type selected is 32b and HMAC Key Type is short key.

section.title: void HASH_Reset (void)
section.emphasis: Resets the HASH processor core, so that the HASH will be ready to compute the message digest of a new message.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: Calling this function will clear the HASH_SR_DCIS (Digest calculation completion interrupt status) bit corresponding to HASH_IT_DCI interrupt and HASH_FLAG_DCIS flag.

section.title: void HASH_DataIn (uint32_t Data)
section.emphasis: Writes data in the Data Input FIFO.

entry.para: new data of the message to be processed.

section.title: uint8_t HASH_GetInFIFOWordsNbr (void)
section.emphasis: Returns the number of words already pushed into the IN FIFO.

entry.para: value of words already pushed into the IN FIFO.

section.title: void HASH_SetLastWordValidBitsNbr (uint16_t ValidNumber)
section.emphasis: Configure the Number of valid bits in last word of the message.

entry.para:
Number of valid bits in last word of the message. This parameter must be a number between 0 and 0x1F.
0x00: All 32 bits of the last data written are valid
0x01: Only bit [0] of the last data written is valid
0x02: Only bits[1:0] of the last data written are valid
0x03: Only bits[2:0] of the last data written are valid
...
0x1F: Only bits[30:0] of the last data written are valid

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: The Number of valid bits must be set before to start the message digest competition (in Hash and HMAC) and key treatment(in HMAC).

section.title: void HASH_StartDigest (void)
section.emphasis: Starts the message padding and calculation of the final message.

section.title: void HASH_GetDigest (HASH_MsgDigest *HASH_MessageDigest)
section.emphasis: Provides the message digest result.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: In MD5 mode, Data[4] filed of HASH_MsgDigest structure is not used and is read as zero.

entry.para: pointer to a HASH_MsgDigest structure which will hold the message digest result

section.title: void HASH_SaveContext (HASH_Context *HASH_ContextSave)
section.emphasis: Save the Hash peripheral Context.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: The context can be saved only when no block is currently being processed. So user must wait for DINIS = 1 (the last block has been processed and the input FIFO is empty) or NBW != 0 (the FIFO is not full and no processing is ongoing).

entry.para: pointer to a HASH_Context structure that contains the repository for current context.

section.title: void HASH_RestoreContext (HASH_Context *HASH_ContextRestore)
section.emphasis: Restore the Hash peripheral Context.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: After calling this function, user can restart the processing from the point where it has been interrupted.

entry.para: pointer to a HASH_Context structure that contains the repository for saved context.

section.title: void HASH_DMACmd (FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the HASH DMA interface.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: The DMA is disabled by hardware after the end of transfer.

entry.para: new state of the selected HASH DMA transfer request. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void HASH_ITConfig (uint8_t HASH_IT, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the specified HASH interrupts.

entry.para:
specifies the HASH interrupt source to be enabled or disabled. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
HASH_IT_DINI: Data Input interrupt
HASH_IT_DCI: Digest Calculation Completion Interrupt
new state of the specified HASH interrupt. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: FlagStatus HASH_GetFlagStatus (uint16_t HASH_FLAG)
section.emphasis: Checks whether the specified HASH flag is set or not.

entry.para:
specifies the HASH flag to check. This parameter can be one of the following values:
HASH_FLAG_DINIS: Data input interrupt status flag
HASH_FLAG_DCIS: Digest calculation completion interrupt status flag
HASH_FLAG_BUSY: Busy flag
HASH_FLAG_DMAS: DMAS Status flag
HASH_FLAG_DINNE: Data Input register (DIN) not empty status flag
new state of HASH_FLAG (SET or RESET)

section.title: void HASH_ClearFlag (uint16_t HASH_FLAG)
section.emphasis: Clears the HASH flags.

entry.para:
specifies the flag to clear. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
HASH_FLAG_DINIS: Data Input Flag
HASH_FLAG_DCIS: Digest Calculation Completion Flag

section.title: ITStatus HASH_GetITStatus (uint8_t HASH_IT)
section.emphasis: Checks whether the specified HASH interrupt has occurred or not.

entry.para:
specifies the HASH interrupt source to check. This parameter can be one of the following values:
HASH_IT_DINI: Data Input interrupt
HASH_IT_DCI: Digest Calculation Completion Interrupt
new state of HASH_IT (SET or RESET).

section.title: void HASH_ClearITPendingBit (uint8_t HASH_IT)
section.emphasis: Clears the HASH interrupt pending bit(s).

entry.para:
specifies the HASH interrupt pending bit(s) to clear. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
HASH_IT_DINI: Data Input interrupt
HASH_IT_DCI: Digest Calculation Completion Interrupt

section.title: ErrorStatus HASH_SHA1 (uint8_t *Input, uint32_t Ilen, uint8_t Output[20])
section.emphasis: Compute the HASH SHA1 digest.

entry.para: pointer to the Input buffer to be treated.
length of the Input buffer.
the returned digest

ErrorStatus enumeration value:
SUCCESS: digest computation done
ERROR: digest computation failed

section.title: ErrorStatus HMAC_SHA1 (uint8_t *Key, uint32_t Keylen, uint8_t *Input, uint32_t Ilen, uint8_t Output[20])
section.emphasis: Compute the HMAC SHA1 digest.

entry.para: pointer to the Key used for HMAC.
length of the Key used for HMAC.
pointer to the Input buffer to be treated.
length of the Input buffer.
the returned digest

ErrorStatus enumeration value:
SUCCESS: digest computation done
ERROR: digest computation failed

section.title: ErrorStatus HASH_MD5 (uint8_t *Input, uint32_t Ilen, uint8_t Output[16])
section.emphasis: Compute the HASH MD5 digest.

entry.para: pointer to the Input buffer to be treated.
length of the Input buffer.
the returned digest

ErrorStatus enumeration value:
SUCCESS: digest computation done
ERROR: digest computation failed

section.title: ErrorStatus HMAC_MD5 (uint8_t *Key, uint32_t Keylen, uint8_t *Input, uint32_t Ilen, uint8_t Output[16])
section.emphasis: Compute the HMAC MD5 digest.

entry.para: pointer to the Key used for HMAC.
length of the Key used for HMAC.
pointer to the Input buffer to be treated.
length of the Input buffer.
the returned digest

ErrorStatus enumeration value:
SUCCESS: digest computation done
ERROR: digest computation failed
